conclusion: To determine whether Object A and Object B have the same acceleration at time \( t_1 \), we need to analyze their velocity-time graphs.
Object A's velocity-time graph is shown in the diagram.
Object B's velocity-time graph is also shown in the diagram.
At time \( t_1 \), Object A is moving with a velocity of \( v_0 \).
The velocity of Object A decreases over time, approaching zero at \( t_1 \).
Object B starts with a velocity of \( v_0 \) and increases its velocity over time.
Object B's velocity increases until it reaches a maximum velocity of \( v_0 \) at \( t_2 \).
After \( t_2 \), Object B's velocity decreases over time, approaching zero at \( t_4 \).

premise: At time \( t_1 \), Object A is moving with a constant velocity of \( v_0 \).
conclusion: Object A has zero acceleration at time \( t_1 \).

premise: Object B is also moving with a constant velocity of \( v_0 \) at \( t_1 \).
conclusion: Object B has zero acceleration at time \( t_1 \).

premise: Since Object A and Object B are moving with the same velocity of \( v_0 \) at time \( t_1 \), they have the same acceleration at that point.
conclusion: Object A and Object B have the same acceleration at time \( t_1 \).
